utterance.content: Just long enough to make me want to kill myself. One minute of lunatics backstabbing each other is enough.

utterance.speaker: HANNAH GREEN
utterance.content: Look, I am not this person. Things just happen and they end up defining you, but it’s – it’s not always fair.

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: That’s it. That’s the last image we shot of Hannah. Poor girl. Such a loss. She was ratings gold. You have to find who did this. The audience will want to know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, not to mention her family, the DA …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Monroe, when was this shot?

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Uh … day before yesterday. About 8PM. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because she’s wearing the same clothes that we found her in. That’s a full day later. Do you know where she went after filming or why she would have been on the Upper West Side?

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Well, to be honest, when the cameras go away so do I. So I don’t even know what she did on her free time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the video she seems upset. Any idea what about?

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Oh, you gotta understand. We brought Hannah in to be Penelope’s assistant. You know, mix things up a little bit. The small town girl with the big time dreams of becoming a fashion designer. Will she make it with the wives of Wall Street? She’s just milking it for the camera. They all do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it’s a reality show, just without the reality.

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: I like to think of it as heightened reality. Reality-ish.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In real reality did she have problems with anyone on the show?

utterance.content: Well, you put a bunch of tough minded women together, you’re gonna get a spat or two. But Hannah was part of the family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, I’m going to need all of her tapes, just in case there’s something relevant.

utterance.content: Hannah always wanted to make it big in the city and when she came here she … she lost her way.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: I should have done more. I was her brother. I should have protected her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Green, when was the last time you talked to Hannah?

utterance.content: Uh … a few days ago. I called her. We fought.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: The usual. About how she was putting her life out there for the world to see. What it was doing to the family. She – she said I didn’t understand. That there was more going on than I knew. But to me it was simple. She needed to come home.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So you didn’t approve of her being on The Wives of Wall Street.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Approve? No. It was killing us. See the choices she made, the way she was living her life. All of it out there on national television. And that was before she started having the affair.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Affair?

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: You screw my husband, you think you’re welcome here?

utterance.speaker: HANNAH
utterance.content: He chose me, Penelope. Deal with it.

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: I am coming for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our victim was sleeping with the husband of one of the other women of the show?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not just sleeping with. Hannah and Bob moved in together after Penelope found out about them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet the show’s producer said nothing about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d say he was covering his own ass …et.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This affair was broadcast on national television. Did he really think that we weren’t going to find out about it?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Oh my goodness, it was Penelope, wasn’t it?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, after what Hannah did to her marriage I wouldn’t blame her. Okay, see, Penelope kept her family afloat after Bob lost his job. And then she gives Hannah this – this big break. And then Hannah repays her by screwing her worthless excuse of a husband.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a fan of Wives of Wall Street?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh yeah, it’s the best show on TV. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t – I just assumed that a woman like you would prefer more sophisticated fare.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Excuse me? What did you just say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m sending you a picture of a fingernail fragment I pulled from the victim’s scalp. I figured it came from the killer during the attack.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you run DNA?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s already happening.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘sito, is it just me or … ?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or is that a perfect match?

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Okay, wait a minute. You’re reading too much into this. Can you at least wait until we’re done filming?

utterance.speaker: COLETTE
utterance.content: We’re not canceling the wedding.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Look, I’m just saying this sucks, okay? Hannah dying a month before our wedding.

utterance.speaker: STONE
utterance.content: Ashley’s right. Maybe you should postpone it, or something.

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: Postpone? For that b*tch?

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: Penelope!

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: Look, it’s not like I killed her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me, Ms. Foster. Detective Beckett, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: How do you do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m fine. But you are under arrest for the murder of Hannah Green.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I guess it is like you killed her.

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Are you still rolling? Did you get that?

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: How dare you arrest me in front of the cast and crew!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You should be more worried about this, Penelope. That’s a lab report for a fingernail fragment found in Hannah’s hair. It’s a DNA match to you. You want to tell me how it got there? Because if you won’t, I’m sure your husband Bob will.

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: Bob? C’mon. What do you think he’s going to tell you? That poor bastard is so stupid he thought that Hannah actually had feelings for him and everybody knew all she wanted to do was up her profile on the show. She was just using him.

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: It was true love. Hannah and I were in love.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We know your wife, Penelope, and Hannah had a fight. Had things been escalating between them lately?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: Hannah and I never talked about Penelope.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But you lived with Hannah. Do you know where she was last night?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: No. She didn’t come home last night and I didn’t see her all day yesterday.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was that unusual?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: Yeah, I was worried. But do you really think that Penelope could have killed her?

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I wanted to kill her. But with all of America watching? How stupid do you think I am?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the fingernail?

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: The truth is, Hannah and I did have a little … dust up. But not the night that she was killed. It was the night before.

utterance.content: Okay, so what was the nature of this dust up?

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: We were filming confessionals. Hannah waited for me outside the studio. Said she wanted to talk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: Margo. Margo hired Hannah after I fired her ass. And no surprise, Hannah and Margo were having trouble at work. And crazy as it sounds, that b*tch wanted me to rehire her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you actually expect me to believe that she asked you for her job back after she ruined your marriage?

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: Why do you think I lost it? I yanked her hair and broke my nail. But that was it. She broke free, took off, and that was the last I saw of Hannah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I suppose you won’t mind me asking where you were between 10:15 and 11:15 last night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so the kickboxing teacher at NoHo Gym confirms that Penelope was “sweating her ass off” downtown in a class ‘til 11. So whoever killed Hannah, it wasn’t Penelope Foster.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay then. Where are we on the murder weapon?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? There’s no fingerprints. But they did find antimony oxide on the knife’s handle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A fire retardant, if memory serves.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And also, based on the wound, it looks like the knife was new or had never been used.

utterance.content: Hey guys, check this out. A fan took this and posted it to a “Wives of Wall Street” fan site the night of the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Hannah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because she was killed around the corner from here just after leaving.

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: That’s terrible.

utterance.content: Yes. Yes, it is. Um, would you mid telling us why she came by?

utterance.content: To apologize.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.content: After Penelope fired Hannah for the affair, I hired her to develop a clothing line with my son, Stone. I heard she had talent and it wouldn’t hurt to get some screen time. The “Wives of Wall Street” cameras were here and ready to roll and Hannah’s a no-show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she say why?

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: No. If it was anyone else, I would fire her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But it didn’t hurt that you had a little more screen time.

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: I know that’s crass, but that how this works. When she came that night, Hannah only said that she was sorry and promised to recommit to her job.

utterance.content: Did she tell you where she was going afterwards?

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: No, I – I assumed that she was going home.

utterance.content: And what did you do once she left?

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: I jumped on a conference call with my entertainment attorney to discuss Stone and Ashley’s spinoff.

utterance.content: You know, the truth is, anyone who subscribes to the “Wives of Wall Street” website would have known that Hannah was at Margo’s building from that photo. They send out text alerts any time there’s a new post and they have hundreds of thousands of subscribers.

utterance.content: Hey. I got a little mystery here.

utterance.content: You mean besides your Valentine’s Day plans?

utterance.content: Shhh.

utterance.content: Hannah’s financials. For the past two months she’s been making weekly cash deposits of $5 grand. Now I checked with the family, everyone on the show. No one knows where it’s coming from.

utterance.content: I take it she didn’t make it selling girl scout cookies.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Uh, sorry. I had to run home and uh …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ****-a-doodle-doo?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s good.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. Tomorrow’s going to be the least romantic Valentine’s Day ever.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So I had tech look into Hannah’s last 24 hours after her fight with Penelope and before showing up at Margo’s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did they find anything useful?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They didn’t find anything at all. She didn’t make any calls, didn’t answer any calls, sent no texts. She didn’t log into her email or any other online accounts. No digital fingerprints whatsoever.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s like she disappeared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would she go radio silent for 24 hours?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where the hell was she?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As in the country off the southeastern coast of Africa made famous by the adorable animated film?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yep. The material I found underneath her fingernails? Not skin from an attacker. It’s alluaudia.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what is alluaudia?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: A rare spiny plant cultivated primarily in Madagascar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So how did it get underneath her fingernails?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Beats me. As for her defensive wounds, they were not sustained at the time of murder. They’re from 24 hours prior.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s about the time that she went off the grid. Which means there’s got to be a connection.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well I think there is. Remember this abrasion?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well I figured out what caused it. He diamond tennis bracelet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But wasn’t that on her right wrist?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Good memory.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So her wrists were tied together.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Tight. And for several hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now it’s making sense. Wearing the same clothes overnight –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The radio silence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the defensive wounds 24 hours prior to death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hannah was held hostage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Hannah was being held hostage, then why didn’t she report it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And how did she get magically transported to Madagascar?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And why would she go afterwards to Margo’s to apologize for missing work?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It has to have something to do with those $5 thousand dollar payments and that meeting with that mystery man at the bar in Brooklyn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It all seems so random. I mean, I know by the end of this all these clues will fit together beautifully in a murderous mosaic.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But how? Wait. Is this your Valentine’s Day gift to me? A complex mystery where nothing makes sense? You know me so well.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Um, I hate to interrupt your little, uh … love connection, but I checked traffic cameras. I found footage of Hannah arriving at Margo’s building. I got the medallion, talked to the cabbie, whose log showed that he picked up Hannah at 78th and Lex.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he say where she was coming from? Building? Store?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He didn’t know. Said that she was standing on the corner when she flagged him down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well then she could have come from anywhere. There’s no way we can narrow that down, bro.

utterance.content: Maybe there is. I spoke to a regulator at the Department of Agriculture. It seems alluaudia is used in green sustainable architecture. In rugs, flooring, wallpaper. Possibly from a building nearby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Espo, you get uniforms to canvass the area around 78th and Lex. Let’s see if there’s any green sustainable buildings that use that allu – whatever the plant is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: As you wish.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Captain Gates, participating in the case. Engaging in idle speculation. We are not so different, you and I.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s … there’s a difference. We’re different.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You know, this could actually be our big break. Only we may not have gotten to it if I hadn’t recognized Margo’s building in that photo. Which is why I think each of you should watch some “Wives of Wall Street” episodes tonight. For the good of the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, want to come over for a little viewing party?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you can badger me about what I’m getting you for Valentine’s Day? No, thanks. I think I will pass.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. But I’m warning you. I’m kind of competitive when it comes to giving gifts. Don’t feel bad if yours isn’t as good as mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What if it’s better?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Better?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How could it possibly be better?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I guess it just depends on what you got me?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh Richard, these are breathtaking.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Beckett is going to love them, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right? She’ll have a tough time competing with that. One of the perils of dating a gift ninja.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, you want to be a real ninja? You just slip these into her coat pocket when she’s not looking.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh Mother, I like that idea. The element of surprise. The ninja way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about you, Alexis? Any plans with Max?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, we’re just going to study together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That doesn’t sound very special.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well I think we’ll mostly just study each other’s eyes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you, Mother. Any special plans?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: We’re going to do dramatic readings of love letters at my studio.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh well, that’s nice. And speaking of drama, would anyone like to join me for a screening of “Wives of Wall Street”? Popcorn included.

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: Three hours is not acceptable, Hannah! We’re running a business, here!

utterance.speaker: HANNAH
utterance.content: I wasn’t at lunch, I was getting fabric samples.

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: That is no excuse for being late. You are not in Kansas, Toto.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shoot me now.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Boy, I wish I’d had these reality shows in my day. No script, overacting, screaming at everybody. What a gig.

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: Now, I have written new provocopy. Read it.

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: So what’s going on between you two?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: Nothing. What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: You’re sleeping with her, aren’t you, Bob?

utterance.speaker: HANNAH
utterance.content: No. No.

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: Don’t lie to me! You’re screwing Hannah! Admit it! Admit it!

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: Yes, all right? I’m sorry!

utterance.speaker: HANNAH
utterance.content: He chose me, Penelope. Deal with it.

utterance.speaker: PENELOPE
utterance.content: You come near me again and I will rip your throat out.

utterance.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterance.content: Coming up next week, Margo’s son Stone, who’s learning the family business from mom, and Colette’s daughter Ashley, budding ceramic entrepreneur, get engaged. Strap in as their moms get busy planning their fairy tale wedding.

utterance.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterance.content: Coming up next, the Shark Pool with bad boy billionaire Mike Chilean.

utterance.speaker: MIKE CHILEAN
utterance.content: You’re funded!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh my God, Dad. You’re still watching?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t feel my butt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s exactly what I mean. Hannah didn’t stand a chance. I mean, she’s a small town, naïve young woman. She was chum to piranhas.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: But – but look what she did to Bob.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. Do you really think that she played him? That Penelope was right about that?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, that girl was smarter than anybody gave her credit for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? I think you’re right.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What about you, Detective? Did you watch “Wives of Wall Street” last night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I watched an episode.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just one episode? That’s like eating one potato chip.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I usually just eat one potato chip.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So what’s the status on the canvass, Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, uniforms are still making their way through every building that uses any trace of alluaudia on the Upper East Side, so nothing yet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. You guys aren’t going to believe this. The sketch of the guy Hannah met in Brooklyn out at the little restaurant just came in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was anyone at the bar able to ID him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They didn’t need to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Mike Chilean.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The crazy billionaire?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And the entrepreneur host of the Financial Channel’s other hit reality TV show “The Shark Pool”.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So why would Hannah ditch her shot to pitch Margo a clothing line and meet with Chilean at a seedy bar in Brooklyn?

utterance.speaker: MIKE CHILEAN
utterance.content: Meeting at that dump was her idea. Me, I’m more of a Le Cirque guy. But she said she needed privacy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: CHILEAN
utterance.content: We met last month at a Financial Channel party. She was … cute. And young. Then a few days ago she calls me out of the blue and asks to meet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it was a date?

utterance.speaker: CHILEAN
utterance.content: That’s what I thought, yes. But when I get there she goes all Shark Pool on me. Starts pitching her idea for a vegan, organic, hipster clothing line.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, she asked you to fund her clothing line? Margo Gower was set to back it on the show.

utterance.speaker: CHILEAN
utterance.content: Well that was the weird part. I was ready to offer her financing. Her name recognition from the show almost guarantees a profit. But then she says ‘what if I were to leave the show? Would that make a difference?’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She told you that she might leave the show.

utterance.speaker: CHILEAN
utterance.content: Yep. So I said, ‘yes, sweetie. That would make a big difference.’ Without the show, her brand isn’t worth jack.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would Hannah suddenly want to leave the show after everything she ever dreamed of started happening for her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, whatever was going on she clearly wanted to keep it under wraps.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Hey, uniforms just got a hit on the canvass from a pretzel vendor who saw Hannah walk in to a nearby building right in our abduction time frame. Records show it’s lead certified, green construction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any evidence of alluaudia in the building?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I checked. It’s in the wallpaper. She was held hostage someplace in the building. Find out where.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On my way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you’ve got the wrong blazer there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No I don’t. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Is everything all right, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. C’mon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have you ever seen her in the building before?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who owns 29J?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there a name listed on it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait. Do you hear that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like someone pounding on a wall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Penelope?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Bob? You two are back toget - ? Spoiler alert.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Bob and Penelope are together? I can’t believe it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Neither of them is talking about Hannah.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well clearly they have a lot more to hide than the fact that they were sleeping together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well this is a plot twist I didn’t see coming.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so I did some digging into the apartment. Ocean Terrace Holdings? It’s a shell company owned by Bob. The lease began just after he and Hannah started their affair.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: That’s odd. When Bob left Penelope he moved into the Thompson Hotel with Hannah. So why would he lease another apartment?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I looked into Penelope’s financials. Remember those $5 thousand dollar payments that Hannah got? They line up exactly with withdrawals that Penelope made from her checking account.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Penelope was paying Hannah? Wha – why would she do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no way to know unless we get her to talk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry – I’m sorry. Have you seen this show? Penelope is the strong one. If anyone’s going to talk it’s Bob.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But he’s not. My guess is he’s afraid of Penelope.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then perhaps it’s time to tear a page from Penelope’s playbook.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon. You guys aren’t actually –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Couldn’t hurt.

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: I told you, I have nothing to say –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did I say you could talk?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did someone give you permission to open your sorry little mouth? No! So sit down, shut up, and listen. We know that apartment’s yours, Bob. We know that Hannah was held hostage there. Which means, I can nail you for kidnapping. That’s 20 years, easy.

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: What? No! I –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you know what? I’m not going to stop there. I‘m going to fry you for murder.

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: Wait, me? I didn’t kill her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t lie to me! You locked her up, you held her hostage. Who does that to someone that they love, you lying sack of –

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: We weren’t in love, okay? It was a lie! The whole thing was a lie. There was no relationship. Hannah and I were never even together.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: We only did it for the ratings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The ratings?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: Ashley and Stone’s engagement was sucking up all the attention on the show. Penelope’s screen time was dropping which was killing her clothing sales. She was out of her mind. So we came up with a plan. Hannah was reluctant at first, but Penelope can be pretty persuasive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the $5 thousand dollars that Penelope was paying Hannah, that was to fake a relationship?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: We never intended for it to end like this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened, Bob?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: The other night, after taping a confessional, Hannah said that she needed to talk. Well the three of us couldn’t be seen together so we met at the apartment. She told us that she couldn’t bear everyone thinking she was this home wrecker. She couldn’t go on living a lie. Then she said she was going to go public. Reveal the affair had been faked all along.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a pretty big bombshell. How’d you guys take it?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: How’d we take it? We panicked. If we let her go through with it, it would blow up the show. We’d lose all credibility. No one would buy Penelope’s clothes anymore. Plus we’d be in breach of contract and the show could sue us for every cent we had. Our whole lives would be ruined.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then you guys tied her up.

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: We didn’t know what to do. So after a whole day went by, we realized we couldn’t hold her forever, so … so we made a call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who did you call? Bob! Who’d you call?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: Peter Monroe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The “Wives of Wall Street” producer?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: We needed help. It’s his show. He had as much to lose as we did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did you tell him?

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: Everything. Then he came over and told Penelope and me to leave. That he would handle Hannah. And we thought he was just going to talk some sense into her. You know. Maybe sweeten her deal. But the next thing we knew Hannah was dead.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: I’m so sorry, sir. I tried to stop them –

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Jeff, get out of here.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Monroe, are you pathologically incapable of telling the truth?

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Well, that depends. What’s this about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your role in Hannah’s murder.

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Whoa. I had nothing to do with her murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bob thinks you did. We know about him calling you from the apartment. About Hannah just before she died.

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Okay. Penelope and Bob called me. A couple of moron idiots, taking her hostage like that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you went over there.

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Of course I went over there. Hell, I saved her from those two lunatics. I’m the good guy. You know what I did when I got there? I let her go. Water?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please. Look, if Hannah exposed that your main storyline was faked your show would go down in flames.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The fans would be outraged. Hell, I’m outraged.

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: I was trying to stop her. I offered her more money. Her own series. Anything she wanted to not blow the lid off the show. I mean, … she was going to ruin everything. I begged her to stay. I followed her out and gave her every decent pitch I had. But she wouldn’t deal. She got into a taxi and I never saw her again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here’s a better story. You grabbed a knife and you followed her.

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: No, I didn’t. I swear. I went straight to the Player’s Club. Ordered a couple of cocktails and waited for my world to start to cave in. But nothing happened. Next morning I found out she was dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the manager at the Player’s Club confirms that Monroe was there from 10PM to well after midnight. He’s not our guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which leaves Margo. ‘cause that’s where Hannah went next. But after being held hostage and demanding to leave the show I doubt she went there to recommit to the job. Margo had to have been lying to us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Margo was lying, all right. She told you she buzzed up Hannah that night, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s impossible. The buzzer in her building connects through her phone. According to the phone records Hannah was buzzed up at 9:57PM. Well, according to Margo’s financials, at almost exactly the same time – 9:58PM – she was using her credit card at Lorenzo’s Deli ten blocks away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks Espo. Margo’s got some explaining to do. If she didn’t buzz Hannah in then who did?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And why would she lie about it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what’s going on with you and Gates today?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously Castle, what were you thinking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I wanted to surprise you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By putting my gift in Gates’ blazer? Okay, I’m surprised.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But why do you and Gates have to wear such similar blazers?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you write a note?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course I wrote a note. I’m a writer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was it romantic?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Valentine’s Day, so yeah, it was romantic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you put my name on it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh God, Castle, did you put my name on it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t remember. I put my name on it. I know that much.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Gates finds out that we’re dating, then that’s it. We’re not going to be working together anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why do you think I’ve been trying so hard to get it back?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, we will get it back. Right when we get back to the precinct. But right now we’ve got a murder to solve. Maybe our last.

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks for buzzing us in.

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: What can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, the interesting thing about this building is that the buzzer system runs through your telephone.

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So anytime anyone gets buzzed up it gets time stamped. And since we know you were at Lorenzo’s Deli buying onions you couldn’t have buzzed Hannah up the night of the murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means that somebody else did. Why did you lie to us? From watching the show, I know that your husband is in Brussels working on a deal, so it couldn’t have been him. Which leaves only one other person living in this house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your son, Stone. He worked with Hannah, didn’t he?

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: I don’t like what you’re implying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were they having problems with each other?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is Stone right now, Ms. Gower?

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: I don’t know. He’s an adult.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Because in season 3 episode 5 you said that you are your son’s keeper, always knowing where he is and what he’s doing. It looks like one of us did their homework. Now Ms. Gower, where is Stone?

utterance.speaker: MARGO
utterance.content: I would like to talk to my attorney.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Entertainment or criminal?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sir, we got him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Where’s he headed?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Stone bought a one way ticked to Buenos Aires. Flight departs in an hour.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Bob and Penelope fake their break up and now poor, sweet, innocent Stone’s a killer? Is anything real on that reality show?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just the headache I get when I watch it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Call TSA. Do not let him get on that flight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why the sudden trip to Argentina, Stone?

utterance.speaker: STONE
utterance.content: I just needed a little time away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know that Hannah showed up at your apartment the night that she was killed and we know that you let her in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then for some reason your mother lied about it. Now why would she do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was it because that Hannah told you that she was going to blow up the show and you suddenly saw your dreams of an Ashley/Stone spinoff going out the window? Is that why your mom lied? Because you followed Hannah out of the apartment and you killed her?

utterance.speaker: STONE
utterance.content: I didn’t kill her! Don’t you guys get it? I was in love with her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, love? What about Ashley?

utterance.speaker: STONE
utterance.content: That was my mom’s idea. Look, I like Ash. We’ve known each other since we were kids, but … then I met Hannah. We bonded over being forced into things that weren’t really us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did anyone else know about the two of you?

utterance.speaker: STONE
utterance.content: No. There was too much at stake. For the past few weeks Hannah just couldn’t take it anymore. What the show was doing to her. Her family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was looking for a way out.

utterance.speaker: STONE
utterance.content: We both were. But the lies had just gotten so big. Her fake affair, my engagement. Ash and my mom, they were counting on that spinoff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened the night that Hannah showed up?

utterance.speaker: STONE
utterance.content: She was hysterical. She said she wanted to leave town right away. That it was now or never. And I was going to, but …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But what?

utterance.speaker: STONE
utterance.content: Then my mom came home. When she found out about our relationship, she went crazy. She threw Hannah out. But the worst part was that Hannah begged me to go with her. But I couldn’t. In the moment that she needed me - to stand up to my mother - I couldn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stone. Did your mother go after her?

utterance.speaker: STONE
utterance.content: No. As soon as Hannah left, I knew I had made a mistake. So I ran out to catch up with her in the street. And I kissed her. I told her I loved her. But she said it was too late. That she never wanted to see any of us again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can anyone verify your whereabouts after you and Hannah went your separate ways?

utterance.speaker: STONE
utterance.content: I took a long walk, so no.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So what do you think? You believe him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He had motive. She was leaving him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he was the last one to see her alive a block away from where she was killed, so …

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Only problem is we don’t have any proof. We can’t tie Stone to the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, we can. On a hunch I took a look at his wedding registry. Turns out, Ashley and Stone are registered for a set of Takahara VG knives, including the 240 millimeter that was shipped out three weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The lab report did say that it was a new knife.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then that seals it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not necessarily. We’re forgetting wedding etiquette. The gifts don’t go to the groom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for coming, Ashley.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Oh, anything I can do to help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You must be so busy planning for the wedding right now, and dealing with all of the gifts.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we know that your cousin bought you that set of Takahara VG knives. The ones that you have on your registry.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The funny thing is, when we went to your apartment you don’t have the 240 millimeter. Isn’t it just a little weird that she wouldn’t get you the whole set?

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: You were in my apartment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we also went to your ceramics studio as well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, your work is lovely, by the way. The colors of your glazes are stunning. I mean, it must take a lot of work to get – to get them just right. A lot of chemicals. Like the um … antimony oxide we found, for example. What is that for?

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: It’s an opacifier. It makes things opaque.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only in this case it seems to make things clear. The knife that was used in Hannah’s murder. We found traces of antimony oxide on it. From you.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You got an alert on your phone from the fan site, didn’t you? That photo of Hannah at Stone’s apartment. I mean, you already had your suspicions. You just confirmed your worst fears.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: No. No. I think we’re done here. I’m going to go. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Excuse me. I – just – let me find my keys and I will go –

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Fine! I had my suspicions. And when I saw that picture I grabbed the knife, just to scare her. But when I got there Stone was kissing her. And saying he loved her. I couldn’t just let her steal my fiancé. Our spinoff was in final negotiations, for God’s sakes.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: So when Stone left I followed Hannah. I put an end to the threat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The next generation of the “Wives of Wall Street” and Ashley takes it to a whole new level.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she was just following their motto. “Don’t let anyone stop you from getting what you want.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As if being on TV somehow made her immune to the consequences. You know, at least we can tell Hannah’s family that the affair wasn’t real. She was actually planning on going home. Speaking of consequences, why hasn’t Gates said anything yet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t know. Maybe she’s choosing to ignore it, or just biding her time. Like a shark.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Night guys. Happy Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah … once more unto the breach?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, actually Jenny just texted me and I have the night off. I mean, we’ll probably still uh … you know, but tonight it’ll be for romantic reasons.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Espo! Your date’s here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I knew they had plans! You knew they had plans and you didn’t tell me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, because she asked me to keep it a secret. This is a really big deal for them. She doesn’t want you making fun of them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wouldn’t make fun – no, that’s not true. It’d be fish in a barrel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, you look great.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah? It’s not too much?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. It might be a little too much for Castle. Eyes up, bud.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You look amazing, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Thanks, Javi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: So, what’s the plan?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, reservations at Le Fouquet.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: French? I love French.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Je le sais, mon petit chou chou. Allons-y.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Au revoir.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Au revoir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, the magic of Valentine’s Day is upon us.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: My office. Now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And there it goes.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Did you really think that I, of all people, would be okay with this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I – thought –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: “You are beauty, passion, and fierce intellect. Be my Valentine. Rick.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that all I wrote in there?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Isn’t that enough? What the hell is wrong with you? I’m a married woman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I know. No, I know. I just thought –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Is this some lame, harebrained scheme to garner favor with me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s – that’s what this is.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, it backfired. And I am willing to forget this ever happened if you can assure me you can tame your childish nonsense and accord me some respect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I will. I can. I will.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And now I will go home. To my husband. Because I’m his Valentine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She already hated you, Castle, so it doesn’t sound like you’re any worse off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do respect the way that she handled it, though. Strong. Decisive. I feel like somehow it brought us closer. I am sorry about the earrings, though.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, me too. They were … stunning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. I will get you something else even more beautiful. Just try not to give it to another woman first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’d be nice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which reminds me. What did you get me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Open it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe it’s in another drawer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It is the drawer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s your drawer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, I know it’s not a lightsaber, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. It’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Happy Valentine’s Day. Now – … take your clothes off, put them in your drawer, and meet me in the bed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously?
